[/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”HSBC UK & UK Black Business Show: Meet 25 Top Black Entrepreneurs to Watch in 2025″ font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:44|text_align:left|color:%23000000|line_height:50px” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][image_with_animation image_url=”22411″ image_size=”full” animation_type=”entrance” animation=”Fade In” animation_easing=”default” animation_movement_type=”transform_y” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1752222591829{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Returning for its fifth year, HSBC UK and the UK Black Business Show are proud to present the 25 Top Black Entrepreneurs to Watch in 2025.

This remarkable collective of Black entrepreneurs, spanning media, fashion, finance, social impact, and beyond, are redefining industries, leading with purpose, and working to drive meaningful progress across the UK business landscape.

The fifth edition builds upon the celebration of over 100 exceptional Black entrepreneurs recognised across 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024. Each entrepreneur featured over the years has demonstrated that when talent meets opportunity, extraordinary achievements follow.

Black entrepreneurs continue to navigate complex challenges and barriers to scale. This 2025 cohort demonstrates the incredible work that results when Black entrepreneurs are able to thrive and deliver against their vision.

These entrepreneurs are living proof that innovation, determination, and strategic thinking overcome any obstacle. They haven’t just built successful businesses, they’ve established pathways for the next generation of entrepreneurs to follow.

Supporting Black entrepreneurs to build, scale, and sustain impactful ventures is essential to the success of the entire global business ecosystem. Such progress requires collective effort. Allies play a crucial role in creating equitable opportunities to level the playing field and ensure doors remain open to all.

As UK Black Business Show celebrates its tenth edition next year, the event has become a cornerstone of Black History Month celebrations. It brings together a network of Black business owners, professionals from various industries, and allies, all committed to championing growth and connection. The Show follows the highly anticipated UK Black Business Week, a series of industry-specific events and networking opportunities designed to offer actionable pathways to uplift underrepresented Black entrepreneurs and professionals.

Through our partnership with HSBC UK, we aim to embrace the spirit of progress, collaboration, and celebration, continuously seeking ways to amplify the achievements of Black entrepreneurs who are shaping the UK’s economic future.

Dr. Raphael Sofoluke, Founder and CEO of UK Black Business Show & UK Black Business Week, reflects on this milestone fifth year:[/vc_column_text][nectar_single_testimonial testimonial_style=”small_modern” color=”Accent-Color” quote=”“Presenting our fifth annual 25 Black Entrepreneurs to Watch list, in collaboration with our long-standing partner HSBC UK, fills me with immense pride. Over the past five years, we have celebrated outstanding Black entrepreneurs, and each cohort continues to exceed our expectations with their excellence and innovation.

Every entrepreneur selected this year deserves recognition, support, and the amplification of their remarkable contributions. Their hard work, sacrifice, and vision deserve our spotlight. We’re proud to showcase this extraordinary collective, and we’re excited to see how their businesses evolve and the impact they’ll create in their respective industries.“”][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20″][divider line_type=”Small Line” line_alignment=”default” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1752165806937{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Tom Wood, Head of SME Business Banking, HSBC UK  added:[/vc_column_text][nectar_single_testimonial testimonial_style=”small_modern” color=”Accent-Color” quote=”“Black entrepreneurs are leading some of the UK’s most exciting, dynamic businesses and it’s vital they have the right support to help them achieve their ambitions. Each of the leaders on this list have their own remarkable stories and we hope they are an inspiration to budding entrepreneurs across the UK.””][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ text_direction=”default”]Social Entrepreneur, Founder & CEO of AVision for Empowerment CIC

Avril Grant, a bold young mother, left her prosperous accounting career during the recession to empower others successfully. In 2012, she established AVision for Empowerment CIC, delivering tailored accredited leadership courses across various sectors. With an unwavering belief in human potential and self-confidence, Avril gave a TEDx talk on ‘Overcoming Uncertainty’ and partnered with the Criminal Justice Sector, guiding 6000 delegates towards desistance and lasting career success. AVision for Empowerment CIC addresses inequality and disadvantage, transforming lives. Our interventions ignite self-belief, enhance mental resilience, reduce youth violence, boost youth employment, and save millions for UK taxpayers. Our vision: “Creating an inspirational world for all, regardless of background.” [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Creative Entrepreneur & Content Creator

Charlie Mase is a dynamic creative entrepreneur, content creator, artist, visionary brand strategist and all-round entertainer. Recognized for his ability to engage audiences with creativity and authenticity. As the host of The Charlie Mase Show, he brings insightful conversations to life, while his expertise in social media growth and digital innovation positions him as a rising force in the industry. Beyond content creation, Charlie shines as a sought-after wedding MC, captivating crowds with his energy, wit and cultural adaptability. His passion for music, storytelling and brand elevation fuels his mission to inspire and entertain. Whether commanding the stage, refining digital presence or pioneering impactful narratives, Charlie continues to shape the future of media, business and entertainment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner css=”” text_direction=”default”]CEO of The Village People

Clement, an entrepreneur based in South London, is the founder of two pubs: Prince of Peckham and Queen of the South in Tulse Hill. Clement came to the UK from Nigeria when he was just six years old, was raised in Peckham and attended a school just a 10-minute walk away from the pub that he now owns.

A love for his area and an interest in people inspired Clement’s venture into hospitality. Keeping the community at the forefront of everything he does, he opened his first pub, Prince of Peckham, to be a ‘solution to gentrification’, aiming to create a space for all to come and enjoy quality food and drink.

In 2022, Clement founded The Village People pub group to educate the community on local issues and challenges, as well as highlighting ways to make a positive difference. Clement has plans to open a new pub every year for the next five years to help give different communities around London a place to meet, socialise and feel welcome, particularly marginalised, and font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Presenter & Broadcaster

Craig Mitch is a multi-talented broadcaster and presenter. As the host of Kick Game’s hugely popular YouTube channel, Craig has interviewed the likes of Burna Boy, Ne-Yo, Rio Ferdinand, Central Cee, and Nella Rose.

Beyond his work with Kick Game, Craig runs his own YouTube series, Comfort Zone, where he brings his signature energy and interview style to unique and engaging conversations.

In broadcast, Craig is a respected presenter at KISS FM and is currently working closely with Channel 4.0. His passion for football led him to become a presenter for TalkSport, BBC Two’s MOTDX, and Premier League TV. He is also the host of his brilliant podcast Double Down.

Some of Craig’s most notable brand partnerships include Sky, NFL, Bacardi, Google Pixel, Expedia, Canada Goose, Levi’s, and Coca-Cola. Craig is a force to be reckoned with and a reputable voice within fashion, music, and sport.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Founders & Book Authors

Brothers Craig and Shaun McAnuff — the culinary force behind Original Flava — grew up in South London, taught by their Jamaican mother and grandmother in “Nan’s kitchen,” where they fell in love with Caribbean cooking. In 2016, they launched Original Flava online, quickly going viral and growing to over 800,000 followers with more than 150 million views. They’ve since published three Amazon best-selling cookbooks, starred as TV chefs, and now run three buzzing kitchen residencies in Tulse Hill, Peckham, and Richmond – drawing thousands each week, including celebrity guests like Stormzy, and bringing their unique Carib-British Sunday Roast to the mainstream. Their mission? To make Caribbean food easy, accessible and full of family-style togetherness, showcasing vibrant flavours beyond jerk chicken. Through community workshops and high-impact events — including a nationwide Supperclub tour — Original Flava fuse heritage with purpose, redefining UK food culture.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner css=”” text_direction=”default”]Managing Director of Ashville Holdings

Daniel Ashville is a presenter, businessman and Managing Director of Ashville Holdings, a company he has built from the ground up, specialising in construction, aggregates, concrete, waste management and plant hire.

As a former model who turned his childhood obsessions for construction and engineering into a thriving set of businesses, Daniel has also managed to build a substantial online following through his YouTube series, Ashville Weekly. The series highlights the trials and tribulations Daniel faces on a day-to-day basis running his businesses but also celebrates the successes including building a bespoke games room for KSI, sponsoring QPR Football Club and growing his fleet from one lorry to over 35 vehicles and machines.

With posts on Ashville Weekly amassing up to two million views, his magnetic personality and profound knowledge caught the attention of National Geographic commissioners. Recognising Daniel’s fearlessness and genuine passion, they swiftly offered him his own show: Building Impossible with Daniel Ashville. css=”” text_direction=”default”]“The Queen Hadassah”, Make-Up Artist & Digital Content Creator 

Esther Appiagyei, also known as The Queen Hadassah from her YouTube days, is a renowned makeup artist with over 15 years of experience in the beauty industry. Esther’s work has been featured in prestigious magazines, such as Vogue. She has worked with numerous high-profile clients, and worked on campaigns for brands such as Burberry, Snickers, and New Balance.

Known for her ability to enhance natural beauty and create stunning looks, Esther is passionate about empowering her clients, leaving them feeling beautiful from the inside out. Her warm and personable approach has earned her a loyal clientele and lasting relationships. 

Esther is dedicated to teaching women makeup skills for themselves, believing in the confidence that makeup can bring. She is also a dedicated mentor and educator, conducting classes to inspire the next generation of makeup artists. Her creativity, and commitment to excellence make her a long standing figure in the makeup industry.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Founder of feYi Flowers

feYi Flowers was born from love, creativity, and a desire to create floral arrangements that truly resonate with modern women. The brand is named after Eni’s daughter, Feyi, meaning “my joy” in Yoruba, symbolising the heart and soul behind everything we do.

Eni’s journey began in her garden, where she taught herself floristry as a form of self-care and creative expression. What started as a hobby quickly evolved into a labour of love. Eni found it difficult to find a floral brand that matched her style, many arrangements felt generic, overpriced, and the floral industry, largely male-dominated, offered few options for women like her.

Determined to change that, Eni created feYi Flowers, a women-led brand designed for modern women. Offering unique, paper-wrapped bouquets that blend wellness, self-care, and a touch of fun. Through our fresh approach, we’re bringing new energy to the floral industry, celebrating individuality and joy.

It’s been an incredible, albeit challenging, journey, and we’re incredibly proud of what we’ve built. A brand that’s not just about flowers, but about embracing creativity, self-care, and the beauty of everyday moments.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Founder & Creative Director at Alonuko

Established in 2012 – at just 17 years old – by British-born Nigerian designer Oluwagbemisola “Gbemi” Okunlola, Alonuko specialises in bespoke bridalwear and ready-to-wear evening designs, crafted and managed by an in-house team of 20 skilled professionals. With a mission to empower women through exceptional design, 

Alonuko blends cultural significance, luxury, and scalability to address evolving market needs.

Operating from its London headquarters, Alonuko is a trailblazing women’s luxury brand generating annual revenues exceeding £1 million. From humble beginnings in Peckham, where Gbemi taught herself to sew at the age of 11 after watching her mother create gowns, Alonuko has grown into an internationally recognised brand. Through its studio in London, online platform, trunk shows and global pop-ups, the brand provides access to its exclusive designs, catering to a diverse and international clientele. By combining innovation and sustainability, Alonuko continues to redefine the luxury bridal market and position itself as a leader in the text_direction=”default”]CEO of Kugali Media

Hamid Ibrahim is a multi award winning Artist who focuses on creative leadership and innovation. He is the co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Kugali Media, a visual entertainment company that focuses on authentic African visual storytelling. Hamid has worked in the highest levels of visual entertainment in Hollywood blockbusters like Lion King (2019), Dumbo (2019), The Predator (2018), The Darkest Minds (2018), Dolittle (2020) and most recently a first of its kind collaboration with Disney Animation Studios, an African created series ” Iwaju”. Iwaju marks the first time in Walt Disney’s 100 year history to collaborate with an outside studio(kugali) to create an original animation and it received three Emmy nominations. Hamid was able to win the Alumnus of the year Award from University of Hertfordshire in 2021 and made it to the list of the MIPAD 100 most influential persons of African Descent list in css=”” text_direction=”default”]Co-Founder & Co-CEO Good Culture Inc & Co-Founder of Good Sport

Jordan Mitchell is the co-founder of Good Culture and Good Sport, two agencies known for shaping how brands, talent and athletes show up meaningfully in culture.

With over a decade of experience across corporate, entertainment, and creative industries, Jordan brings a unique blend of commercial acumen and cultural insight to her work. Having started her career within leading corporate environments, Jordan transitioned into brand and talent strategy with a focus on long-term impact. She has since led cultural positioning and partnership strategy for brands such as Barbour, Creed, Pattern, Flannels, Airbnb, SKIMS, Marc Jacobs, and Good American. Her strategic work also extends to talent working with the likes of Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Dina Asher-Smith, Alessia Russo, Naomi Schiff, Rochelle Humes, Clara Amfo, and Sabrina Elba through narrative development, brand alignment, and global visibility.

Jordan regularly contributes to wider industry conversations through platforms like The Telegraph and Grazia, where she writes on topics spanning diversity, motherhood, and career evolution offering a personal perspective on the shifting dynamics of modern leadership.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”] Founder & CEO of Yendy Skin

Yendy is an African Superfood beauty brand that develops results-driven formulations whilst creating a fairer supply chain for female farmers across sub-Saharan Africa. Julian got his start as a door-to-door charity fundraiser, learning the fundamentals of sales and storytelling, before spending 8+ years working across several high-growth UK startups and scale-ups, including Monzo.

Since launching Yendy in 2022, he has transformed it into a leading multi-six-figure brand that directly sources from over 200 women in Northern Ghana while paying premium rates and funding local community projects. Yendy’s success has earned features in British Vogue, Harper’s Bazaar, Hello!, and the Evening Standard. Last year the brand was hand-selected to front Adobe’s biggest UK and US small business campaign. Justice Williams MBE is a personal branding expert, business strategist, and award-winning entrepreneur dedicated to helping women turn their expertise into profit. As the founder of Black Business Magazine and Elevate, her premium membership for female entrepreneurs, she has built a platform that empowers women to grow profitable and purpose-driven brands. She is the Vice Chair of the Greater Birmingham Chamber of Commerce, Black Business Collective.

Justice is also the founder of TEDxLadywood Women and the host of the Dream Plan Launch podcast, where she shares insights on personal branding, business, and mindset. Her upcoming book, How to Succeed on Purpose, will be released in November 2025, providing a powerful blueprint for women looking to create a freedom-filled business.

As the co-founder of two kids, Justice balances entrepreneurship with motherhood, championing financial empowerment and opportunities for women.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner text_direction=”default”]Co-Founder of Kurl Kitchen & Founder of No Knot Co.

Keshia East is the founder of No Knot Co. and co-founder of Kurl Kitchen—two haircare brands dedicated to textured hair. A former celebrity makeup artist turned entrepreneur, Keshia launched her businesses after losing her father in 2020. Inspired by his encouragement to one day start her own venture, she teamed up with her sister to build brands that celebrate and serve the curly and coily hair community. What began as a personal journey grew into innovation—developing award-winning detangling tools and launching West African–inspired hair care products now stocked in over 800 UK stores. Passionate about education, inclusivity, and representation in beauty, Keshia also leads school workshops and works with charitable initiatives for young women. Her work has earned recognition from major retailers—and even the King of England. Through it all, Keshia remains driven to empower others through heritage-rooted products and real representation, one brush, curl, and conversation at a css=”” text_direction=”default”]Host of Building Wealth with No Borders Podcast & CEO of WNB Group

Lámidé started her wealth building journey over 8 years ago determined to have a better financial future than the one she grew up with. Her pursuit of understanding money and wealth led her to study at the London School of Economics and she consequently joined JP Morgan and Citi investment bank to learn more about money and the world of finance. She purchased her first property in the UK just 6 months after graduating and went on to purchase a property internationally at the tender age of 24. She has reached her goal of financial independence in her mid-20s, investing and moving seamlessly between the UK and the UAE. Lámidé is eager to share strategies on how others can do the same and now hosts the Building Wealth with No Borders podcast, the largest black-led, wealth-focused podcast in the UK. She also supports investors with investing in property overseas.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Michael Heaven
Co-Founder & Managing Director of Butterfly Effect

Michael Heaven co-founded Butterfly Effect and has spent 10 years engineering agency growth. A founding team member of Social Chain, he spearheaded its US launch, then ran Offbeat, a Mark Cuban–backed company in Atlanta. Michael now turns those hard-won scale-up tactics into sharp, actionable strategies for emerging founders.

Elfried Samba
Co-Founder & CEO of Butterfly Effect

Elfried Samba is the Co-Founder and CEO of Butterfly Effect, a marketing agency helping brands grow through community-driven marketing, culture, and creativity.

As Global Head of Social Content at Gymshark, he helped scale the brand’s fitness community from 1.5 million to over 20 million followers, contributing to its rise to a £1 billion valuation alongside giants like Nike and Lululemon.

In its breakout year, Butterfly Effect partnered with Netflix, Bumble, McDonald’s, and Square, establishing itself as a go-to agency for culturally relevant, community-led campaigns.

Over the past five years, Elfried’s personal LinkedIn has become the second most engaged account on LinkedIn (Globally), generating 500M+ impressions, 9M+ engagements, and 370K+ followers — setting a new benchmark for personal brand-led growth on the platform.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Founder & Creative Director of Kílẹ̀ńtàr

Michelle Adepoju is the Founder and Creative Director of Kílẹ̀ńtàr. Raised in a Nigerian household in the United Kingdom, Michelle’s parents instilled in her a deep sense of pride and connection to her Yoruba heritage. As a young art student, she developed a keen interest in fashion and upcycling, spending weekends transforming hidden treasures from second-hand shops into unique statement pieces.

After graduating, Michelle embarked on a journey across West Africa, immersing herself in the history, cuisine, and fashion of each destination, while exploring various creative mediums. Her travels unveiled to her the rich tapestry of textiles and craft across the continent, a shared language with varying dialects.

In 2019, fuelled by her experiences and wanderlust, Michelle founded Kílẹ̀ńtàr as a love letter to the skilled artisans she encountered during her travels. Since then, she has been recognised as a designer to watch and continues building a global brand known for its elegance and feminine silhouettes and in 2025, Michelle was honoured at one of Forbes 30 under 30. Through Kílẹ̀ńtàr, Michelle champions sustainability and circular design practices, utilising traditional African methods to reimagine the fashion industry that centres craft over consumption.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]TV Presenters, Podcast Hosts & Property Entrepreneurs

Scarlette and Stuart Douglas are the brother/sister presenting duo taking television by storm. With first-hand experience in property development, the siblings are intent on sharing their expertise and insight with newcomers and old hands in the housing market.

Upon its 2022 launch, Scarlette & Stuart’s show, ‘Worst House on the Street’ achieved huge ratings on Channel 4. Its success led to the commission of two further series, with it continuing to be at the top of the ratings. They have also filmed a new Channel 4 series, ‘Can’t Sell, Must Sell’ which has aired receiving acclaimed reviews.

In addition, the pair have released the Property Unlocked podcast which can be found on all major platforms and are developing a second podcast which will be available for download soon.

2025 has been a busy year for Scarlette and Stuart, with appearances on Celebrity Bake Off, featuring on the Main Stage at the Ideal Home Show, and participating in celebrity specials of The 1% Club and Deal or No Deal.

Alongside their work in the media, Scarlette and Stuart continue to renovate their own investment properties.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:35|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=””][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Film Director & Founder of Dope Black Art

Sebastian Thiel is a writer, director and art curator from North West London, originally born in Zambia. At just 17, he launched Upshot Entertainment with a bold mission – to tell the stories he didn’t see growing up, whilst amplifying black talent. His breakout series Just A Couple began on YouTube and was later picked up by BBC Three. Since then, he’s gone on to direct some of the UK’s most talked-about shows, including Dreaming Whilst Black (BBC), Riches (ITV/Amazon), and Netflix’s Supacell. 

Off-screen, Sebastian founded Dope Black Art to celebrate Black creativity through visual storytelling. He also runs Upshot Reels, crafting showreels for rising and established talent like Damson Idris and Letitia Wright. Named a Broadcast Hot Shot and included in the BBC Hotlist by Idris Elba, Sebastian continues to develop new projects for film and TV. He is represented by 42 in London and UTA in Los Angeles.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” Shannie is the Co-founder & Head of Culture and Communities at The Elephant Room, a creative advertising agency based in London. Having worked with Global brands such as; PUMA, Chivas Regal, Barclays, Pinterest and more. Shannie has become a cultural leader in the creative space after 10 years of empowering, creating and building a more purposeful industry. She was named Management Today’s 35 under 35 young woman in Business, Se was also named Forbes 30 under 30 and became a 1xtra Future figure. Shannie lectured for 2 years at Kingston University within the creative and cultural industries department, and previously sat on the Race disparity advisory board at no.10 Downing street advising on race and policy. text_direction=”default”]Founder & CEO of Black Ballad

Tobi Oredein is an award-winning entrepreneur, speaker, and journalist. She is the Founder and CEO of Black Ballad, a leading media platform and community for black women in Britain. Tobi’s work spans across media, advocacy, and business, focusing on issues related to diversity, representation, and equality. Through her leadership at Black Ballad, she has become a prominent voice in conversations about race, culture, and gender, advocating for systemic change within the media industry and beyond.

Tobi has successfully collaborated with major brands, including L’Oreal Paris, Garnier, Google and Spotify, to create unique campaigns and experiences that empower black women to live their best lives. 

In celebration of Black Ballad’s 10-year anniversary, Tobi created the Black Ballad Weekender, a flagship event that brought together over 1,500 black women from across the UK for a weekend of inspiration, community, and empowerment. The event showcased Black talent across various industries, further cementing Black Ballad’s role as a pioneering platform for Black women’s voices and stories and is becoming a staple in the cultural calendar for Black British women.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes”
